intro: Dyssodia porophyllum subsp. cancellata, commonly known as the silverleaf dyssodia, is a member of the Asteraceae family. It is a perennial herb characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It is native to arid and semi-arid regions of Australia, where it thrives in well-drained soils. This species is often found in open woodlands and rocky habitats, adapting to harsh environmental conditions.
